metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14350 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
It was found that some PostgreSQL extensions did not use search_path safelyin their installation script. An attacker with sufficient privileges coulduse this flaw to trick an administrator into executing a specially craftedscript, during the installation or update of such extension. This affectsPostgreSQL versions before 12.4, before 11.9, before 10.14, before 9.6.19,and before 9.5.23.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14350` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libecpg6 - 9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpq5 - 9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
